card.name: Abyssal Specter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

card.name: Act of Treason
card.ability: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison.—Sarkhan Vol
card.ruling:
10/1/2009: Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that's untapped or one you already control.

8/15/2010: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab.
-Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea

card.name: Ascendant Evincar
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
card.flavor: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.
card.ruling: 7/15/2007: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

card.name: Banefire
card.ability:
Banefire deals X damage to target creature or player.
If X is 5 or more, Banefire can't be countered by spells or abilities and the damage can't be prevented.
card.flavor: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009: Banefire checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent.

2/1/2009: Banefire can be targeted by spells that try to counter it (such as Countersquall) regardless of what the value of X is. If X is 5 or more, those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Banefire won't do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.

2/1/2009: Banefire's ability won't prevent it from being countered by the game rules if its target has become an illegal target.

card.name: Blanchwood Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
card.flavor:
"Before armor, there was bark. Before blades, there were thorns."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

card.name: Blaze
card.ability: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Fire never dies alone.

card.name: Bloodmark Mentor
card.ability: Red creatures you control have first strike.
card.flavor: Boggarts divide the world into two categories: things you can eat, and things you have to chase down and pummel before you can eat.

card.name: Boomerang
card.ability: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Æthermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.

card.name: Cancel
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Cinder Pyromancer
card.ability:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.
card.flavor: If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold.

card.name: Civic Wayfinder
card.ability: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square.

card.name: Cloud Sprite
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

card.name: Coat of Arms
card.ability: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
card.flavor: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.

10/4/2004: If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.

10/1/2009: Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

card.name: Consume Spirit
card.ability:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).

10/1/2009: If the targeted creature or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell is countered. You won't gain any life.

card.name: Counterbore
card.ability: Counter target spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
5/1/2008: Counterbore has no effect on cards on the battlefield that have the same name as the targeted spell.

5/1/2008: The cards you're searching for must be found if they're in the graveyard, because that's a zone everyone can see. Finding those cards in the hand and library is optional, though.

5/1/2008: In most cases, Counterbore will exile the targeted spell. Its first sentence counters the spell, which puts it into its owner's graveyard. Its second sentence then removes it from the graveyard. However, there are some exceptions to this, as listed below.

5/1/2008: If the spell's controller isn't the same as its owner (due to Commandeer, for example), it won't be exiled. The spell is countered and put into its owner's graveyard. Then the spell's controller's graveyard, hand, and library are searched.

5/1/2008: If the targeted spell can't be countered (it's Vexing Shusher, for example), that spell will remain on the stack. Counterbore will continue to resolve. You still get to search for and exile all other cards with that name.

card.name: Crowd of Cinders
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Crowd of Cinders's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black permanents you control.
card.flavor: They envy the life-giving heat so much that they tear it from those who still possess it.

card.name: Deluge
card.ability: Tap all creatures without flying.
card.flavor:
From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better.
—Emperor Aboshan

card.name: Demon's Horn
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.

10/1/2009: If a player casts a black spell, Demon's Horn's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon's Horn's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Denizen of the Deep
card.ability: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.

card.name: Dragon's Claw
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.

10/1/2009: If a player casts a red spell, Dragon's Claw's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon's Claw's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Drove of Elves
card.ability:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Drove of Elves's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green permanents you control.
card.flavor: The light of beauty protects our journeys through darkness.

card.name: Drudge Skeletons
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
card.flavor: The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off.—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

card.name: Dusk Imp
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

card.name: Duskdale Wurm
card.ability: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

card.name: Earth Elemental
card.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

card.name: Elven Riders
card.ability: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
card.flavor: Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

card.name: Elvish Champion
card.ability: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor:
For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high.
—Elvish hymn
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.

8/1/2005: This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

card.name: Elvish Eulogist
card.ability: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007: By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

card.name: Elvish Promenade
card.ability: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield for each Elf you control.
card.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.

card.name: Elvish Visionary
card.ability: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.

card.name: Elvish Warrior
card.flavor: As graceful as a deer leaping a stream and as deadly as the wolf waiting in ambush on the other side, elvish warriors are the eyes of the forest as well as its unsheathed claws.

card.name: Enrage
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The barbarians call it “touching the soul of a dragon”.

card.name: Essence Drain
card.ability: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it.
—Crovax, ascendant evincar
card.ruling: 7/1/2012: If the target creature or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

card.name: Essence Scatter
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.
card.flavor: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Evacuation
card.ability: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are.
—Alexi, zephyr mage

card.name: Eyeblight's Ending
card.ability: Destroy target non-Elf creature.
card.flavor:
Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one.
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

card.name: Furnace of Rath
card.ability: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
card.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.

10/4/2004: The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.

10/4/2004: If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.

10/4/2004: The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

8/1/2005: If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting himself or herself. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

card.name: Gaea's Herald
card.ability: Creature spells can't be countered.
card.flavor: Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The ability applies to your opponent's spells as well as your own.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

card.name: Goblin Piker
card.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

card.name: Goblin Sky Raider
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: "The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

card.name: Greenweaver Druid
card.ability: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The other tribes call them fanatics, but none deny that the Mul Daya elves have an iron-strong bond to some force greater than themselves.

card.name: Hill Giant
card.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

card.name: Howl of the Night Pack
card.ability: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each Forest you control.
card.flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

card.name: Immaculate Magistrate
card.ability: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.
card.flavor: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.

card.name: Imperious Perfect
card.ability:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

card.name: Incinerate
card.ability: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
card.flavor: Yes, I think ‘toast' is an appropriate description.—Jaya Ballard, task mage
card.ruling: 7/15/2007: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

card.name: Jagged-Scar Archers
card.ability:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.
{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.

card.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
card.ability:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: The Legend rule only applies to two Legends with identical names. If the names are similar, but different, the rule does not apply.

card.name: Kraken's Eye
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.

10/1/2009: If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken's Eye's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken's Eye's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

card.name: Lightning Elemental
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
card.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave.
-William Knox, "Mortality"

card.name: Loxodon Warhammer
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker. Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
card.ability: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn’s Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren’s Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

card.name: Mahamoti Djinn
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

card.name: Megrim
card.ability: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
card.flavor:
It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?
-Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

card.name: Mind Control
card.ability:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
“Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?”
-Jace Beleren
card.ruling: 8/15/2010: Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

card.name: Mind Rot
card.ability: Target player discards two cards.
card.flavor:
“The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them.”
-Volrath

card.name: Mind Shatter
card.ability: Target player discards X cards at random.
card.flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.

card.name: Mind Spring
card.ability: Draw X cards.
card.flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

card.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

card.name: Moonglove Winnower
card.ability: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
card.flavor: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

card.name: Mortivore
card.ability:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
card.flavor: Rare

card.name: Natural Spring
card.ability: Target player gains 8 life.
card.flavor:
Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides.
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

card.name: Naturalize
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

card.name: Nature's Spiral
card.ability: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. (A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.)
card.flavor: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.

card.name: Negate
card.ability: Counter target noncreature spell.
card.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Overrun
card.ability: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

card.name: Phantom Warrior
card.ability: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
card.flavor:
The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks.
-Jace Beleren

card.name: Prodigal Pyromancer
card.ability: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man.
card.ruling: 2/1/2007: This is the timeshifted version of Prodigal Sorcerer.

card.name: Rage Reflection
card.ability: Creatures you control have double strike.
card.flavor: Vengeance is a dish best served twice.
card.ruling: 5/1/2008: If a creature loses double strike after assigning damage in the "first strike" combat damage step (due to Rage Reflection leaving the battlefield, for example), that creature won't assign damage in the "normal" combat damage step.

card.name: Rampant Growth
card.ability: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.

10/4/2004: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Ravenous Rats
card.ability: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
card.flavor: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

card.name: River Boa
card.ability:
Islandwalk
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.

card.name: Roughshod Mentor
card.ability: Green creatures you control have trample.

card.name: Runeclaw Bear
card.flavor: Bears aren’t always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

card.name: Sengir Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
card.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.
card.ruling:
7/15/2007: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

9/22/2011: Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.

9/22/2011: If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

card.name: Severed Legion
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

card.name: Shivan Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

card.name: Shock
card.ability: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
“Once I saw a goblin shouting at a thunderstorm. He lost the argument pretty quickly.”
-Wandering mage

card.name: Snapping Drake
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.

card.name: Spined Wurm
card.flavor: Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

card.name: Talara's Battalion
card.ability:
Trample
Cast Talara's Battalion only if you've cast another green spell this turn.

card.name: Terror
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: The Rack
card.ability:
As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in his or her hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004: You choose one opposing player as this card enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Thieving Magpie
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
card.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.

card.name: Trained Armodon
card.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

card.name: Troll Ascetic
card.ability:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

card.name: Underworld Dreams
card.ability: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.
card.flavor:
In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan.
-Rabindranath Tagore
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.

10/4/2004: In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

card.name: Unholy Strength
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
card.flavor: Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart.—Codex of the Constellari

card.name: Unsummon
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It’s only fair that they occasionally throw one back.

card.name: Verdant Force
card.ability: At the beginning of each upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004: Verdant Force's controller gets the tokens. That is the controller at the beginning of upkeep.

8/1/2005: Once created, the tokens are independent of Verdant Force. If Verdant Force changes controllers, the new controller will put tokens onto the battlefield, but existing tokens will stay where they are.

5/1/2006: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

card.name: Vigor
card.ability:
Trample
If damage would be dealt to a creature you control other than Vigor, prevent that damage. Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Vigor is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007: The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

10/1/2007: Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

10/1/2007: If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

10/1/2007: If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

card.name: Wall of Spears
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
card.flavor:
“A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend.”
-Onean sergeant

card.name: Wall of Wood
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
card.flavor: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.

card.name: Wurm's Tooth
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a green spell.

10/1/2009: If a player casts a green spell, Wurm's Tooth's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Wurm's Tooth's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.
